result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas E Jaeger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school.
No contact with R.V.F. or The Neighbors place.

Counseling
SAFE program
Anger Managment
Letter of apology to victim- The Neighbors place.
DNA sample w/ surcharge- if done does not need to be duplicated.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 9:05am. INCLUDES 14CF947, 14CM1464. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Kat Jackan. 
*VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 1 (child abuse); ct 2 (strangulation); ct 4 (carry concealed); ct 5 (bj) in 14CF947 - crt grants. State moves to ct 2 (receiving stolen property) 14CM1464- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 3 (substantial battery) 14CM947; ct 1 (theft) 14CM1464. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Defense. Defendant makes statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 3 yrs on ct 3 in 14CF947 and 1 yr on ct 1 in 14CM1464, concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: 90 days MCJ for on ct 3 in 14CF947; 90 days credit - time served; Counseling; SAFE Program; Anger Management; 40 hrs Community Service; Restitution - $500.00 Neighbors Place- to pay off in 1 yr; Crt finds defendant has ability to pay;  ltrs of apology to victim Neighbors Place; No contact with R.V.F. or Neighbors Place; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge; DNA Sample & Surcharge on 14CF947- if done does not need to be duplicated. Defendant completes Ineligible Voting Form. Adjourned: 9:20am.
Plea hearing on January 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
